strapiPost.title: New Non-Profit To Host Event On Grief Sunday
strapiPost.content:
This Sunday, a new local non-profit is hosting a virtual event for women, and the topic is grief. 

  • Standing together: Resilient Black Women (RBW) is a new non-profit here in Northwest Arkansas dedicated to educating and supporting the Black, Latinx, Indigenous, and Asian-Pacific Islander women of our community with regard to mental health. The founders are Licensed Professional Counselors, and for Sundayâ€™s event wish to guide women through processing grief through culture and art.
  • For all: During the event, there will be 3 community guest speakers and 2 spoken word performers. Folks from all walks of life are welcome to attend. The founders of RBW wish their nonprofit to be a safe place for everyone.

To register and for more information, click HERE.
